No excuses in MedEd - the resources on systemic racism are available. It is time for us to teach DEI as a core competency for future physicians.

The way Step 1 can stifle curriculum change has been a running MedEd and MedEdChat topic. I dont think we have looked as much at how USMLE stifles change for assessing competency and for residency match. To me, we have, in part, outsourced this process to USMLE scores.

I would welcome a debate around the role of writtenoral exams in a competency MedEd system. devilsadvocate - exams are valid amp robust and I get it but still... seems like an exercise in learningjob bottle neck rather than something that changes patient care
